timeline.summary: On October 23, 2019, at 6:30 PM GMT, Marc Weinstein (with a redacted attendee) participated in a Skype meeting classified as X-PERSONAL regarding the Epstein estate. The meeting was created on October 23, 2019, at 1:47 PM GMT and has a priority level of 5.

On October 23, 2019, at 6:30 PM GMT, a Skype meeting occurred with Marc Weinstein and the Epstein estate. The meeting was classified as X-PERSONAL. The meeting was created on October 23, 2019, at 1:34 PM GMT and has a DTSTAMP of 1:20 PM GMT.

Marc Weinstein sent an email to Andrew Tomback regarding the Epstein estate. The email included dial-in numbers for various countries and provided instructions for joining a Skype for Business meeting, differentiating between meetings with presentations/video and those without. The email also offered assistance for first-time users joining the meeting from a computer. The document is identified as EFTA00024296.

Marc Weinstein of Hughes Hubbard & Birch contacted Andrew Tomback of White & Case on November 25, 2019, regarding a call related to the Epstein estate. The communication included dial-in numbers for international participants, categorized by country and region, and instructions for joining meetings via telephone or computer with video/presentation capabilities. The document identifies the file as EFTA00029636.
On November 25, 2019, Marc Weinstein received an email from the Epstein estate regarding an accepted call. The email is attached as “unnamed” and dated November 25, 2019.

Marc Weinstein of Hughes Hubbard & Reed LLP is sending documents related to a subpoena regarding the Epstein estate to Andrew Tomback and others. He is providing advance notice of the documents' impending delivery and requesting a brief discussion. The email includes standard confidentiality disclaimers.

Marc A. Weinstein of Hughes Hubbard & Reed LLP is preparing to send documents related to subpoenas from the Epstein estate to an individual identified as "[REDACTED]". He contacted Weinstein to provide a heads-up before sending the documents and offered a brief discussion. The email includes standard confidentiality disclaimers.

An Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York is sending contact information to Marc Weinstein and Andrew Tomback regarding subpoenas related to the Epstein estate. The attorney requests a meeting this Wednesday at 9:30 AM and encourages contact at any time, including over the weekend.

On December 2, 2019, at 3:30 PM GMT, Marc Weinstein (redacted) participated in a Skype meeting (Conference ID: 169 269 771) with the Epstein estate. The meeting was classified as X-PERSONAL and lasted from 3:30 PM to 4:00 PM GMT. The event was created on November 25, 2019.

On December 2, 2019, at 3:30 PM GMT, a Skype meeting occurred with Marc Weinstein (REDACTED) regarding the Epstein estate. The meeting lasted from 3:30 PM to 4:00 PM GMT. The event was classified as X-PERSONAL.

On December 2, 2019, at 3:30 PM GMT, a Skype meeting titled “Epstein Estate Call” occurred, organized by Marc Weinstein of Hughes Hubbard &amp; Palmer. The meeting attendee was [REDACTED], and also included Tomback, Andrew of WhiteCase. The meeting utilized the dial-in number +1 (201) 630-0824 and conference ID 169269771. Additional dial-in numbers were provided for various countries including Brazil, Canada, China, France, Germany, India, Ireland, Israel, Japan, Singapore, United Kingdom, and United States. A reminder message was to be displayed 15 minutes before the start.

*   Weinstein responded on January 7, 2020, stating he would provide an update by Thursday. *   Weinstein then replied on January 7, 2020, stating that a call was unnecessary and that he would get back to them on the requests. *   A subsequent email on January 7, 2020, from the Assistant U.S. Attorney reiterated the request for an update and inquired about the possibility of a call.

On May 19, 2020, Andrew Tomback, a partner at White & Case LLP, contacted Weinstein and another individual regarding a follow-up question about the estate’s possession of photographs and videos related to Jeffrey Epstein’s properties. Tomback stated the estate and trustees were unaware of surveillance videos and that some photographs existed without warrant searches. He requested digital copies of those photographs, initially due to the estate’s inability to retain assistance, and then inquired about the possibility of someone currently accessing the properties to convey the photographs due to the pandemic. The email includes a request to verify the accuracy of the recollection and to determine if any progress could be made in obtaining the requested images.

Andrew Tomback of White & Case LLP responded to a request for photographs and videos related to Jeffrey Epstein’s properties. He stated the estate and trustees had no historical surveillance videos and were unaware of existing physical video recordings. He indicated some photographs existed within the Florida and New Mexico residences but were not subject to search warrants. The estate’s inability to retain someone to obtain digital copies of these photographs was a previous obstacle. The sender requested an update on the possibility of someone currently accessing the properties to convey photographs. The email also includes a standard disclaimer from the Assistant U.S. Attorney's office.

Marc Weinstein of Hu hes Hubbard & Reed LLP is requesting a call with the recipient around 1:00 PM on July 8, 2020, regarding the Epstein estate. The email includes standard confidentiality disclaimers.

On July 16, 2020, Marc Weinstein of Hughes Hubbard & Reed LLP sent emails to coordinate a call regarding the NY property of Jeffrey Epstein. He requested a call between 1:00-1:45 PM and offered a dial-in option. Two individuals responded, agreeing to the call time and confirming their availability. The emails included standard legal disclaimers regarding confidential information and email transmission security.

Marc Weinstein of Hughes Hubbard & Reed LLP contacted [REDACTED] on July 16, 2020, regarding an update on the Epstein NY property. Weinstein proposed a call time between 1:00-1:45, and offered to use a dial-in option. The email included standard confidentiality disclaimers.

Marc A. Weinstein of Huhes Hubbard & Reed LLP sent an email to [REDACTED] inquiring about an update on a New York property owned by Jeffrey Epstein. He requested a call today between 1:00-1:45 to discuss the update. The email includes standard confidentiality disclaimers.

Marc A. Weinstein of Hughes Hubbard & Reed LLP sent an email on July 16, 2020, to inquire about an update regarding the New York property owned by Jeffrey Epstein. The email was sent to [REDACTED] and included Cc’s to Ian, Alison, Maurene, and Andrew Tomback. The original email request was from Alex to determine if Weinstein would have time for a call between 1:00-1:45 PM regarding the property.

On July 16, 2020, at 5:30 PM GMT, Marc Weinstein of Hughes Hubbard & Birch (marc.weinstein@hugheshubbard.com) participated in a Skype meeting (Conference ID: 612 758 867) regarding the acceptance of Epstein’s New York property. The event was classified as “X-PERSONAL,” had a priority level of 5, and was created/modified on July 16, 2020. The DTSTAMP was July 16, 2020, 3:43 PM GMT.

On July 16, 2020, at 5:30 PM +0000, Marc Weinstein (marc.weinstein@hugheshubbard.com) participated in a Skype meeting (Conference ID: 612 758 867) regarding the acceptance of Jeffrey Epstein’s New York property. The event was classified as “X-PERSONAL,” had a priority of 5, and was created and last modified on July 16, 2020.
An email was sent from “)” to Marc Weinstein on July 16, 2020, regarding the acceptance of an Epstein NY property (EFTA00031302). An unnamed attachment was included.

Marc Weinstein received an email on July 16, 2020, regarding the acceptance of a property belonging to Jeffrey Epstein (identified as “EFTA00031304”). The email was from “l” to “Weinstein, Marc A.” and was attached as an unnamed document.

An Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York is coordinating with Marc Weinstein and Andrew Tomback regarding the production of materials related to the estate of Jeffrey Epstein. The Attorney agrees with a plan to scan photographs and produce them electronically. They are open to receiving original materials like a photo book if scanning is not feasible. Loose, unlabeled discs are not requested currently, but their production will be considered if they contain photos. The Attorney emphasizes that the government isn’t requesting a privilege waiver but intends to seek a formal position on whether the estate will waive attorney-client privilege for discovery review in the United States v. Maxwell case. Until a formal position is obtained, the government will assume the privilege remains in effect.

A U.S. Attorney’s Office from the Southern District of New York (SDNY) sent a letter to Andrew Tomback and Marc Weinstein regarding an ongoing investigation. The letter, attached as a PDF named “2020-07-26,_JE,_letter to_trustees_counsel.pdf,” is a follow-up to previous discussions.

On July 27, 2020, Marc Weinstein of Hughes Hubbard & Reed LLP communicated on behalf of the Co-Executors of the Estate of Jeffrey E. Epstein. The Co-Executors confirmed they would not use Section 2.5(B) of the 1953 Trust to suggest retaliation against individuals cooperating with law enforcement investigations. They also stated they would notify the US Attorney’s Office for the Southern District of New York in advance of any disbursements to Ghislaine Maxwell and would not waive applicable privileges, including attorney-client privilege, regarding seized materials. An attached letter from the Assistant U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York provided context for this communication.

On July 27, 2020, Marc Weinstein of Hughes Hubbard & Reed LLP responded to an inquiry regarding the Estate of Jeffrey E. Epstein’s actions related to the SDNY investigation. The Co-Executors confirmed they would not utilize Section 2.5(B) of the 1953 Trust to suggest retaliation against individuals cooperating with law enforcement. They also stated they would notify the U.S. Attorney’s Office before any disbursements to Ghislaine Maxwell and would not waive applicable privileges, including attorney-client privilege, regarding seized materials. An attached letter from the Assistant U.S. Attorney confirms receipt of the Co-Executors’ response.

*   Jack Scarola is corresponding with an attorney (identified as [REDACTED]) regarding the transcript’s availability. *   Marc Weinstein and Andrew Tomback, attorneys representing the executors of Epstein’s estate, have been provided with Scarola’s contact information. *   The sender confirms they haven't shared details about Scarola’s client’s investigation. *   There’s an inquiry about potential protective orders or agreements governing the disclosure of materials from the civil case. *   Court reporting and video evidence confirmation indicates the original deposition transcript (Volume I) is missing. *   Mike Danchuk’s detailed notes from the deposition are attached, describing the deposition and highlighting the patterns of grooming and victimization involving vulnerable young women. *   A standard legal disclaimer is included regarding the confidentiality and privileged nature of the communication.

Marc Weinstein, a partner at Hughes Hubbard & Reed LLP, is assisting the Assistant United States Attorney’s Office in the SDNY investigation. He initially contacted Jack Scarola, an attorney representing the plaintiff, to obtain a transcript. Weinstein requested a letter confirming the absence of a protective order, seeking to ensure the Estate could provide the transcript to the US Attorney’s Office. He then inquired about the identity of the deponent for the transcript, and followed up on the possibility of a call to discuss the matter. The US Attorney’s Office provided contact information for Jack Scarola and confirmed the deposition occurred in 2009, involving Jeffrey Epstein.  There was ongoing discussion about confidentiality restrictions and the need for a confirmation regarding the lack of a protective order.

Marc Weinstein, a partner at Hughes Hubbard & Reed LLP, is facilitating the retrieval of a transcript related to an SDNY investigation. The investigation centers around a deposition, likely from 2009, involving a plaintiff represented by Jack Scarola. Weinstein is coordinating with the US Attorney's Office and the plaintiff’s counsel, who is unaware of any protective order.  He initially requests a call to discuss the transcript and then, after realizing the deponent's name is missing, asks for it. The US Attorney’s office provides information regarding Jeffrey Epstein’s representation of the involved parties. A scheduling conflict is resolved for a team call on Friday at 10 AM to discuss the transcript. The entire communication is marked with cautions regarding email security and confidentiality.

Marc Weinstein, a partner at Hughes Hubbard & Reed LLP, is assisting the US Attorney's Office in obtaining a transcript related to an SDNY investigation. Initially, he contacted Jack Scarola to request the transcript, which was originally a deposition. Concerns arose about potential confidentiality restrictions, leading Weinstein to request a letter from the plaintiff’s counsel (represented by the US Attorney) confirming the lack of a protective order and waiving any claims related to its disclosure. Weinstein connected with the plaintiff’s attorney, confirming that the plaintiff’s name is [REDACTED] who is represented by Jack Scarola, and asked for a dial-in for a call. The US Attorney confirmed the lack of a protective order. The email chain details the process of securing the transcript and navigating potential legal concerns.

On November 9, 2020, at 21:30:00 UTC, a Skype meeting occurred with Marc Weinstein and the Epstein Estate. The meeting, identified by Conference ID 570 579 045, was classified as X-PERSONAL. The meeting was created on November 9, 2020, at 16:22:32 UTC and remains unchanged.

A Skype meeting took place on November 9, 2020, at 4:30 PM - 5:00 PM (UTC-05:00) Eastern Time. Marc Weinstein organized the meeting with Andrew Tomback, related to the Epstein Estate. The meeting used Conference ID 570 579 045 and provided a list of international dial-in numbers for access via telephone.  The meeting details were recorded and associated with document EFTA00009915 and EFTA00009916.

An email was sent from [REDACTED] to Marc Weinstein on November 9, 2020, regarding an update on the Epstein Estate. Andrew Tomback is copied, and the email is associated with the "USAHUB-USAJouma1111" alias. The email is labeled as a reply to an update titled “Epstein Estate update.”

Marc A. Weinstein of Hughes Hubbard & Reed LLP sent an email on November 9, 2020, to inquire about a call regarding an update on the Epstein Estate. He offered to conduct the call himself or push it to the following day. The email included a forwarded message from Weinstein to Andrew Tomback regarding a request for a call to discuss a new development related to the estate. The email contained standard disclaimers regarding confidential information and email transmission security.

On November 9, 2020, Marc Weinstein of Hughes Hubbard & Reed LLP was contacted by [REDACTED] regarding an update on the Epstein Estate. [REDACTED] requested a call this afternoon to discuss a new development. Weinstein responded with a similar request for a call, and [REDACTED] confirmed availability. Weinstein included a standard confidentiality disclaimer in his email.
An email was sent from "Weinstein" to Marc Weinstein on November 9, 2020, regarding the acceptance of the Epstein Estate (EFTA00028118). An unnamed attachment was included.

Marc Weinstein scheduled a Skype meeting on November 9, 2020, at 4:30 PM - 5:00 PM Eastern Time (UTC-05:00) with Conference ID 570 579 045 and Dial-In Number +1 (201) 630-0824 to discuss the Epstein Estate.  Additional dial-in numbers were provided for international participants including Brazil, Canada, China, France, Germany, India, Ireland, Israel, Japan, Korea, Singapore, United Kingdom, and United States. The meeting details included instructions for joining via computer or mobile device, or by telephone.

*   The primary focus is on identifying the attorneys representing the estate, initially led by inquiries about Marc Weinstein and Andrew Tomback. *   A private investigator, Roy Black, is mentioned in connection with a criminal investigation. *   There’s an ongoing effort to determine whether communications involving private investigators are protected by attorney-client privilege. *   Jack Goldberger is identified as an attorney representing Epstein, and emails referencing him are flagged for privilege review. *   A request is made to remove “Goldberger hits” (likely referring to emails or information related to Goldberger’s representation) from the database. *   The email chain involves discussions about privilege issues, database reviews, and coordination between individuals.

An email chain discusses a call regarding the Epstein Estate update. Marc Weinstein proposes a call this afternoon, but [REDACTED] suggests postponing it to the following day to allow for more review time. The email thread includes a forwarded message from Weinstein outlining the request for an update.

Marc Weinstein of Hughes Hubbard & Reed LLP sent an email regarding a potential fabricated warranty deed related to a Palm Beach property owned by Jeffrey Epstein. He attached a warranty deed (OR 31849 39 Wlipdf) and noted a similar deed had been filed for a New Mexico property. The email included standard confidentiality disclaimers.

An email chain discusses a call regarding the Epstein Estate update. Marc A. Weinstein requests a call to provide an update, proposing options for the call’s timing and leadership. Another individual expresses willingness to join the call, stating they will continue reviewing images. A standard confidentiality disclaimer is included within the email.

Marc Weinstein of Hughes Hubbard & Reed LLP received an email regarding a potentially fabricated warranty deed for a Palm Beach property (EFTA00029068). A colleague, Andrew Tomback, informed Weinstein that their office was declining to investigate the matter, advising Weinstein to contact local authorities. Weinstein had previously sent a warranty deed for a similar property in New Mexico (EFTA00029069). Both emails included standard disclaimers regarding confidential information and email transmission security.
An email was sent from "USANYS" to " " regarding a call with Andy Tomback and Marc Weinstein (Epstein estate) on March 31, 2021. The email is attached as EFTA00018019.

This email details a tentative phone call between individuals identified as Andy Tomback and Marc Weinstein (representing the Epstein estate) on March 31, 2021, regarding EFTA00032446. No attachments were included.

On April 5, 2021, a call occurred between Andy Tomback and Marc Weinstein (Epstein estate) from 7:30 PM to 8:00 PM. The call was marked as X-PERSONAL and created on March 31, 2021. One attendee is redacted.
A tentative call was scheduled for 2021-04-05 19:30:00 - 20:00:00 +0000 with Andy Tomback and Marc Weinstein (Epstein estate). The call was classified as X-PERSONAL. One attendee is redacted.

The document details a communication chain regarding attorney-client privilege assertions related to seized electronic devices from Jeffrey Epstein’s residences. The Estate is asserting privilege across multiple devices, including those seized in New York, the USVI, and Palm Beach, Florida. A request is made to determine if the Estate is also asserting privilege regarding the 2005 Palm Beach seizure.  Multiple parties are involved – Hughes Hubbard & Reed LLP (Marc Weinstein), McLaughlin Stern LLP (ATomback), and the Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York. Scheduling conflicts are discussed, and a meeting time of 3:30 PM on Monday is proposed. Redactions obscure the content of several emails.
